Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: Maybe the issue has to do with it being the live version not the installed ubuntu. Since the portable version Did work for me. How do I generate a pirate address?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: Goto Receive button > click on "Get New Address" -- select private Z - address

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: Note: make sure to take backup of private key as well

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: trying to create a new asset chain, but haven't had any luck.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: The nodes don't seem to be connecting for some reason

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I do this on my first computer:

```
./komodod -ac_name=AAA -ac_supply=1000 -addnode=185.245.87.44 &
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: so that should get it started.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
then, on the second computer, I've entered this:

```
./komodod -ac_name=AAA -ac_supply=1000 -addnode=(myip) -gen -genproclimit=$(nproc)
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
In both cases, I'll get the same `magic` value, the same port, etc.

The second node will also start attempting to mine.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: However, the mining never realizes.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I went to the first node and entered:

```
komodo-cli setgenerate true
```

and got a positive response.

No balance came, still.

So I tried:

```
komodo-cli getaddednodeinfo true
```
And got a response showing that the nodes aren't connected.

```
[
  {
    "addednode": "185.245.87.44",
    "connected": false,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "address": "185.245.87.44:10970",
        "connected": "false"
      }
    ]
  }
]
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I'm using a VPN on the second node, so that I can get separate ip addresses for each. My experience with networks is limited, so I'm guessing this is a p2p networking issue in the way I have things set up, but I don't know for sure.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Help is appreciated. Thank you.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Example:
computer 1 IP: 185.245.87.44
computer 2 IP: 185.245.87.45

computer 1: `./komodod -ac_name=AAA -ac_supply=1000 -addnode=185.245.87.45 -daemon`

computer2: `./komodod -ac_name=AAA -ac_supply=1000 -addnode=185.245.87.44 -gen -genproclimit=$(nproc) -daemon`

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```-addnode=(myip)
-addnode=185.245.87.44 &```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: instead of variable, try with value first... helps with troubleshooting

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: test and check if ports are open to each other.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: can't think of any other reason these not working ü§î

Content: no need of vpn and stuff

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Cool, make a record of your problems @Bryan_Beus because you won't have been the first (i can guarantee you that!) and you won't be the last.
The first time i made an AC, i ran into the same problems - and the problem was me.   I had an expectation that something would happen and it did, it just didn't happen the way i had expected it to.
IIRC you have to mine a block and the supply is on the node you don't expect ;)

Other things to note are basic networking troubleshooting like ping, traceroute, telnet to the port from both local and remote machines, check fw rules if any and look at the ~/.komodo/AC_NAME/debug.log for any hints.   <---- this is an often overlooked step, even by experts üòâ

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: "experts"

Content: üòÉ K, will do, today

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
Small correction :

```First run non mining chain with no gen param

cd ~/komodo/src
./komodod -ac_name=EXAMPLECHAIN -ac_supply=1000000 -addnode=<IP address of the mining node> &
Then, on mining node, run with below params
cd ~/komodo/src
./komodod -ac_name=EXAMPLECHAIN -ac_supply=1000000  -gen -genproclimit=$(nproc)```

This way, Its working fine, Tested just now

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: @Bryan_Beus

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Bryan_Beus if the node is behind a router, you have to port forward the p2p port

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@Alright 

I've tried using the p2p port that I get from the `.conf` file.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Is there something else?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
This p2p port must not be blocked by a firewall. If the computers do not have public IP addresses, you will need to port-forward the p2p port on both computers and append the forwarded port to the IP. For example:

./komodod -ac_name=EXAMPLECHAIN -ac_supply=1000000 -addnode=<IP of the second node>:8096

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I've done this.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I've tried appending the port to both chains on launch, but still I'm not getting a positive connection.
